title: Microplastics: The long legacy left behind by plastic pollution - UNEP
body: One of the most damaging and long-lived legacies of the plastic pollution crisis is microplastics, a growing threat to human and planetary health. The article discusses the devastating impact of microplastics on the environment and human health, emphasizing the need for collective action to address this issue. It sheds light on the sources of microplastics, including cigarettes, clothing, and cosmetics, and provides recommendations for individuals, businesses, and policymakers to reduce microplastic pollution. The article also highlights the initiatives undertaken by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) and emphasizes the importance of global collaboration to combat the pervasive threat of microplastics.
